channel.title: How to return a message?
channel.description:
So I am working on a code but i've ran into a problem. How do i make a code return a message. Example, [code]if((ItemID == 317) || (ItemID == 321) || (ItemID == 327) && (c.playerLevel[c.playerCooking] >= 2) && (UsedOnObjectID == 3039)) {[/code]
Lets say they dont have the required level. How do i make it send a message. And also I want it to return it, not like if (c.playerleve... < 2) I was wondering if you could do it like: [code]return; c.sM("Hi");[/code]
or something like that

item.title: How to return a message?
item.dc:creator: @I_am_beast I am beast
item.description:
@I_am_beast wrote:

If it’s for PI, here you go:

case ####:
if (c.playerLevel[c.playerCooking] < 2) {
Do action
} else if (c.playerLevel[c.playerCooking] !< 2) {
c.sendMessage("blah blah blah");
return;
}

THIS CODE WILL NOT WORK IF YOU DON’T EDIT IT. (not tested)
Customize to your liking.

Read full topic

item.title: How to return a message?
item.dc:creator: @jaruanna jaruanna
item.description:
@jaruanna wrote:

Well i used it like this:

c.sM(“hi”);
if (c.playerLevel[c.playerCooking] < 2) return;

but it still said the message “hi” although im a higher level than 2

Read full topic

item.title: How to return a message?
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

c.sM(“hi”);
return;

The return statement is used to explicitly return from a method.

Read full topic
